settingsPane.description: Here you can tune CPU Thermal Controls, with this kernel ROM thermal service and Intelligent Thermal Kernel driver can be enabled together! To protect your device from overheating and melting the chipset, screen and your fingers! Controls below are active for Dual Intelligent Temp Control. In case the ROM service dies, kernel will protect your chipset, LCD and other components from damage! only if Dual Intelligent Temp Control is used.
settingsPane.name: CPU Thermal Protection

spinner.description: CPU Thermal control, Can be Default driver without controls, or Dual Intelligent Thermal driver with controls below and ROM thermal control. It will limit CPU frequency when CPU reach the max limit heat, till cooled and restore full power, by using Default Temp Control you have one temp protection by ROM, and if ROM stuck and hot boot there is no one to protect your CPU from heat up the LCD and burn it, BUT you get better game performance by using ONE protection. When Dual Intelligent Temp Control enabled, kernel protects your hardware in any condition! reboot or hot boot! or any other problem. Also it's possible to use only Intelligent Temp Control, then ROM service is turned OFF. only kernel control the CPU temp.
spinner.name: CPU Temp Control

seekBar.description: Here you can adjust the temperature CPU cores can reach before they are throttled down in order to allow the CPU to cool down and keep the phone at normal temperature.
seekBar.name: CPU Max Heat

seekBar.description: Here you can adjust the Frequency Step when throttling down.
seekBar.name: Frequency Step

seekBar.description: Here you can adjust the Temp Pull Timer interval, lower set force driver to check temp faster and tune max frequency.
seekBar.name: Temp Pull Timer

seekBar.description: Here you can adjust the Temperature Hysteresis for driver to calculate temp difference and adjust the frequency, if you stress CPU often! (high temp) Do NOT reduce below 10C!
seekBar.name: Temperature Hysteresis

seekBar.description: Here you can adjust the Thermal Limit Lowest Frequency, 7 = 1.19GHz, 6 = 1.03GHz and so on.
seekBar.name: Thermal Limit Lowest Frequency

checkbox.description: Here you can enable or disable Immediately Limit Stop. It's allow to set max frequencies if heat is not rising, it's stress the driver but allow higher performance and add 3c temp to global limit, use with caution.

checkbox.label: Immediately Limit Stop

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune HotPlug CPU Thermal Controls, ON or OFF cores when over temp to reduce heat. This will reduce performance, as you get one core enabled but on full power!, others will wait till heat will be reduced.
settingsPane.name: HotPlug CPU Thermal Controls

spinner.description: Hotplug CPU Thermal control main switch, this allow to shutdown cores 1,2,3 and leave core 0 as main core on high frequency. It's reduces global performance on high temp, if set disabled then all CPU cores will be online and operate at lower frequencies when the temperature is high!
spinner.name: HotPlug Thermal CPU Control

spinner.description: Here you can control how many cores will stay active on high temp, more cores OFF will give you higher frequency on cores that remain Online, disabled Cores can go online by auto if temp is below the set mark in control below, Change will take effect ONLY on LOW Temp! do not change on high CPU stress, depend on Hotplug CPU Thermal control Enabled above!
spinner.name: Max online CPU's

seekBar.description: Here you can change HotPlug CORES Max Heat before turning OFF cores from 3 to 1 and keep normal phone heat. you need to set this control BELOW Max TEMP Control in above section! then cores will go down when overheated! Depends on Intelli CPU Cores Control (must be ENABLED)!
seekBar.name: Intelli CORE Max Heat

seekBar.description: Here you can adjust the Core HotPlug Temperature Hysteresis for driver to calculate temp difference and adjust the online cores by turning them OFF Depends on Intelli CPU Cores Control (must be ENABLED)!
seekBar.name: Core Temperature Hysteresis

settingsPane.description: Here you can tune CPU HotPlug and CPU Governors.

spinner.name: Hot Plug Driver

seekBar.description: Here you can select CPU hotplug sample rate, hotplug driver will check for load every sample rate period and turn cores on/off as needed, it's highly recommended to set same sample rate as set for CPU Governor in CORE TAB. note 10 here is 10000 for CPU GOV.
seekBar.name: CPU HotPlug Sample Rate

spinner.description: CPU HotPlug Suspend Control - you can allow hotplug to be suspended when screen is OFF. It will enable 3 cores and stop it's function as cpu on and off controller, when device enter suspend mode only one core is ON in state of suspend, then resume when screen is ON. This is for all kernel hotplugs, default hotplug is not supported. After many tests it's best to allow hotplug to always work, as it will reduce battery drain when playing music with screen off!
spinner.name: Hot Plug Suspend Mode

spinner.description: Additional CPU HotPlug control - here you can tune how many cores will be active on a high load spikes for a short time (default is 2 cores for 4 sec). If you wish to save more power when using MSM or Intelligent HotPlug, then it is best to use 1 core boost. If performance is what you prefer, then use DUAL or more cores boost. Depend on MSM or Intelligent Hot Plug selected!
spinner.name: Hot Plug CPU Booster

seekBar.description: Here you can adjust the CPU BOOST time duration, when hotplug turn the amount of boosted cpus on spike load. It's for MSM and INTELLIGENT Hotplugs only! 1000msec equal 1sec (default is 1000msec).
seekBar.name: CPU Booster Duration

spinner.description: Maximum allowed CPU Cores online - you can have QUAD CORE, or select CPU CORE type that you want. This mod will work with all custom hotplugs! Default LG hotplug is not supported. This set is stronger than MIN cores online below!
spinner.name: Max Cores online

spinner.description: Minimum allowed CPU Cores online - here you can set the minimum number of CPU cores to be online nonstop when screen is ON. By default, we have only one core online when device is idle. You can set 2, 3 or all 4 if you wish - this will give your device much more power, but will drain the battery faster and warm up the device faster. Default is NORMAL (one core online + other cores offline until needed). This setting is weaker than MAX cores online above! If you set 2 max cores online and 4 min cores online, you get 2 cores max.

checkbox.label: Adaptive LMK

seekBar.description: Adaptive LMK trigger point, when ram pressure is higher than set here, LMK is ordered to release RAM fast and allow fast load of something BIG to memory, we see it as fast app load and less LAG. lower the value, then more apps killed from RAM and with less actual need. For best performance, keep it in range of 85 to 90%.
seekBar.name: Adaptive LMK Pressure Range

checkbox.description: Control for kernel process memory reclaim, it's help to reduce used RAM of each APP that loaded in background. when vm memory pressure jump higher and system needs RAM for something BIG to load, process reclaim start to shrink used RAM by background APPS, it's also shrink the ZRAM swap if enabled in order to reduce CPU power usage when RAM is free.
checkbox.name: Process Memory Reclaim
checkbox.label: Process Reclaim

seekBar.description: Control for max vm pressure for process memory reclaim, allow to shrink RAM from other apps when vm pressure is in range from 50 to set here value. When value is lower that default (90), then less ram shrink when something BIG should have be loaded to RAM. It's will reduce CPU usage when loading big app. but load it slower as memory should be free first by LMK.
seekBar.name: Max Process Reclaim Pressure

spinner.description: Here you can set the level of low memory management by kernel lowmemkiller function. More aggressive equals more free RAM, but more killed apps.

spinner.description: Here you can set the level of low memory management by kernel lowmemkiller function. More aggressive equals more free RAM, but more killed apps.

If less than 280MB, use recommended or high pressure setting.

seekBar.description: Dirty background memory buffer. The more you set, the more memory will be used for write buffer for background operations. Buffer is released when it is needed to free RAM.

seekBar.description: Dirty real time memory buffer. The more you set, the more memory will be used for real time operations writing buffer. Buffer is released when it is needed to free RAM.

When switching ZRAM size from one to another will take some TIME! in some cases that will take more than 2min! and Dorimanx app will FREEZE! DO NOT PANIC! If selinux is OFF apps may get access to files in system but not change them, with ROOT access, they can! with or without selinux. If SELINUX is disabled! (default set on boot) then life is good! and all works! with no problems with GSM connection or access permissions with different apps. When you push this button ONCE, kernel command line is updated and current kernel is reinstalled by auto! So don't play with this too much. To see changes you will need to REBOOT! Then you can check using check button above! WARNING some USER apps loose some or all data! (mostly configurations) when permissions changed. Do apps backup before switching selinux to ENABLE!
